workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 5.2 - Bishop
workout_file.description: A mainly zone 2 ride with some low cadence work at zone 3.

textevent.message: Welcome to a nice and easy day today, my friend.
Let's get started with a 10min warmup, keep your cadence comfortable here.
Keep on easing into things here, hopefully the cadence is feeling more fluid.
All right, there's halfway through the warmup. Let's chat about the plan for today.
As you know, today is a low key day at zone 2 and 3 intensities.
Having low intensity days threaded in with high intensity training is important.
This training balance is key for maximum return on training.
And will allow you to dig even deeper during the high intensity training days.
So, today we'll be alternating 3min 30sec at zone 2 and 90sec zone 3.
As well as changing up the cadence between comfortable and low - 65 RPM.
We'll also be doing some standing work today during the low cadence efforts to change things up.
Let's carry on with the warmup.
1min to go, then we'll take a couple of minutes easy.
All right, that's it for today's warmup. Take it easy for a couple of minutes now.
Take a few deep breaths here and make sure you're drinking.
All right, we're starting at at comfortable cadence, and seated...Here we go!
Just find your rhythm for this 1st rep and settle into things.
30sec, then we'll drop the cadence and stand up.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
If you experience any discomfort here, please sit down and increase your cadence again.
Great work! Sit back down again now and resume a comfortable cadence again.
Get ready to stand back up again in 30sec and repeat that process.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Perfect! Sit back down again now and keep spinning those legs comfortably.
Make sure you're sipping those fluids consistently today.
All right, 30sec and we're standing up again.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Great work! That's 3 reps down and 6 more to go.
You should still feel well in control here, keep nice and steady.
Get ready to stand up again, aim for a smooth transition to standing here.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Beautiful! Back to sitting again and comfortable cadence.
How does the standing work feel? If you feel awkward during, that's a sign you need to practice more :-)
30sec, then we're standing up again, get ready here.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Way to go! Back in the saddle again and get those legs spinning.
30sec and we're standing again, remember to make these transitions smooth.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Just 3 more reps to go and we're done! Keep it up nice and smooth here.
Take a deep breath here and get ready to stand up in 30sec.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Nice effort! Just 2 more reps to go, take a couple sips of fluid here.
Get ready to stand up again, 2nd to last time!
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Excellent! Just 1 more standing effort to go.
Stand up for 90 seconds and drop the cadence.
Way to go today, my friend! Hopefully the legs and mind are feeling great now.
We'll take 5min to cooldown, then we're DONE :-)
See you next time!
